request_pathways.name: Authorization to Release and Disclose Patient Information
Mail to Attn: Med Recs, 1312 W. 6th St, Lawrence, KS 66044

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: Patients use a single general-purpose 'Authorization to Release and Disclose Patient Information' PDF form for all records requests, including patient self-access.

red_flags: Witness signature line present on form — not explicitly required but its presence may deter patients
Double liability waiver for email delivery may discourage patients from choosing electronic delivery
Mental health records require a completely separate form and cannot be combined with other record types
bright_spots: Pre-bundled 'Record Set' option reduces decision burden with a curated default records bundle
Multiple submission channels offered: email, fax, and mail
Plain-language opening sentence provides patient-friendly context
Single-page form keeps the process concise

findability.rationale: Level 3: requires moderate effort — the form was not found via generic web searches and required a site-scoped search to locate in a WordPress uploads directory, suggesting it is not prominently linked from patient-facing pages.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 2: primarily a paper workflow — despite being a born-digital PDF with a text layer, it has zero fillable fields, requiring patients to print and handwrite; submission can be done electronically (email/fax) but the form itself demands a paper step.

content_design.rationale: Level 4: well-organized with minor issues — the form has a logical flow, clear section ordering, a helpful pre-bundled record set option, and plain-language opening, but is very dense for a single page and the mental health records restriction adds confusion.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 2: patient self-access is an afterthought — the form is a generic third-party release authorization with 'Records From/To' fields designed for transfers, not individual access; 'Patient's Request' is merely one checkbox among several purpose options with no dedicated pathway.

compliance.rationale: Level 3: some requirements that may go beyond what the law requires — the ambiguous witness signature line could be interpreted as a barrier, no fees are disclosed or waived, no Right of Access reference is included, but revocation rights and treatment non-conditioning are properly stated.

overall.summary: Heartland Community Health Center provides a functional but paper-dependent generic release form with multiple submission channels, lacking a dedicated patient access pathway or fillable fields.
